CardPickup

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • CardPickup.Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HankScorpio, MaxPower, TestPlayer

    public abstract class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Player agent. NOTE TO STUDENTS: The game master will only tell the player the results of your and your opponents actions. It will not update your graph for you. That is something we left you to do so that you can update your graphs, opponent hand, horoscope, etc. intelligently and however you like.
    Version:
    04/15/2015
    Author:
    Marcus Gutierrez

    • Method Detail

      • setCurrentNode

        public void setCurrentNode(int newNode)
        There is code in GameMaster which will keep track of legal moves. Trust it to call this function to update your location if your movie is legal.
        Parameters:
        newNode - id of a neighboring node or current node.

      • setOpponentNode

        public void setOpponentNode(int newNode)
        Sets the opponent's current location
        Parameters:
        newNode - location of opponent

      • getCurrentNode

        public int getCurrentNode()
        returns your current location
        Returns:
        current location

      • setHand

        public void setHand(Hand h)
        Sets your current Hand. This does not change your actual hand, just your copy of it. The GameMaster keeps track of your actual hand.
        Parameters:
        h - hand

      • setGraph

        public void setGraph(Node[] g)
        Imports a new graph
        Parameters:
        g - graph

      • opponentAction

        protected void opponentAction(int opponentNode,
                              boolean opponentPickedUp,
                              Card c)
        THIS METHOD SHOULD BE OVERRIDDEN if you wish to make computations off of the opponent's moves. GameMaster will call this to update the player on the opponent's actions.
        Parameters:
        opponentNode - Opponent's current location
        opponentPickedUp - Notifies if the opponent picked up a card last turn
        c - The card that the opponent picked up, if any (null if the opponent did not pick up a card)

      • actionResult

        protected void actionResult(int currentNode,
                            Card c)
        THIS METHOD SHOULD BE OVERRIDDEN if you wish to make computations off of your results. GameMaster will call this to update you on your actions.
        Parameters:
        currentNode - Opponent's current location
        c - The card that you picked up, if any (null if you did not pick up a card)

      • addCardToHand

        public void addCardToHand(Card card)
        There is code in GameMaster which will keep track of legal moves. Trust it to call this function if your movie is legal.
        Parameters:
        card - Name of card to add - ex "Six of Hearts"

      • getHandSize

        public int getHandSize()
        GameMaster will use this method to determine if a player has finished their moves
        Returns:
        size of hand

      • initialize

        public abstract void initialize()
        Allows players to make any initial computations

      • handleAction

        public void handleAction()
        This method forces the subclass player to make a single action (pickup or move a card). Returning a null/invalid action will result in a wasted turn.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get Agent Name used by GameMaster.
        Returns:
        Name of player

      • makeAction

        public abstract Action makeAction()
        Player logic goes here in extended super

      • getLastAction

        public Action getLastAction()
        GameMaster uses this method to determine the last action of the player
        Returns:
        last action the player has made

      • isValidAction

        protected boolean isValidAction(Action a)
        Method that is used to determine if a move is valid. This method should be used to help players determine if their actions are valid. GameMaster has a local copy of this method and all the required variables (such as the true graph), so manipulating the variables to turn a previously invalid action in to a "valid" one will not help you as the GameMaster will still see the action as invalid.
        Parameters:
        a - A proposed action from your current position in the given graph
        Returns:
        True if the action is valid, false otherwise
